definition: scroll/book/volume/chapter/examination paper/classifier for books, paintings: volume, scroll
to roll up/roll/classifier for small rolled things (wad of paper money, movie reel etc)
to roll (up)/to sweep up/to carry on/roll
to be weary of/to be fed up with/tedious
lit. diligent and never slacking (idiom); continuous concentrated effort/assiduous (in study)/to concentrate
instructing with tireless zeal (idiom, from Analects)
study tirelessly, teach with endless enthusiasm (idiom, from Analects)
pinyin: xue2 er2 bu4 yan4 , hui4 ren2 bu4 juan4

sentences.english: And hast borne, and hast patience, and for my name's sake hast laboured, and hast not fainted.
sentences.chinese: 你也能忍耐，曾为我的名劳苦，并不乏倦。

sentences.english: In the hustle and bustle of day, thoughts constantly Pianfei, has some of the Juan.
sentences.chinese: 在喧嚣的白日里，思绪在不断地翩飞，已有些倦了。

sentences.english: I will also give him the morning star.
sentences.chinese: 你也能忍耐，曾为我的名劳苦，并不乏倦。

sentences.english: The spores yielded in larval cadavers were highly toxic to the mosquito larvae.
sentences.chinese: 增殖的芽孢同样对致倦库蚊幼虫有较高毒力。

sentences.english: The leaves are tired of the butterfly, in turn son flying, like most of his heart.
sentences.chinese: 落叶是倦了的蝴蝶，打着转儿飘扬，像极了他的心。

sentences.english: Wang became tired, sitting in the green grass on the ground.
sentences.chinese: 王冕放牛倦了，在绿草地上坐着。

sentences.english: The exhausted mother smiled at the wail of her newborn baby.
sentences.chinese: 听到新生儿的哭叫声，倦极了的母亲笑了。

definition: lit. boat made of lily magnolia wood/poetic term for boat
variant of 佇|伫[zhu4]/to stand for a long time
to stand for a long time/to wait/to look forward to/to accumulate
late at night/in the dead of night
